content: crossing paths cowl/ infinity scarf pattern by tara briggs @taralovescrochet november 1 2020 for the matching hat pattern check out the crossing paths hat on ravelry or threadfolio crossing paths hat pattern ravelry crossing paths cowl - tara briggs 1 notes instructions are written for two lengths cowl - about 28 around and infinity scarf - about 60 around stitch counts and yardage are noted as cowl infinity scarf the width/height of the cowl/scarf as written is about 8 yarn 230 540 yards light worsted weight 4 yarn i used manos del uruguay alegria grande but any lighter worsted weight should work well for this hook 4 5mm us 7 or g+ gauge 16 st by 9 row for 4 by 4 in pattern stitch this gauge is without blocking gauge swatch pattern chain 18 row 1 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook double_crochet across row 2 chain 2 turn skip 1 st double_crochet 1 in next st double_crochet 1 in skipped st working in front of the st just made across row 3 chain 2 turn double_crochet across repeat row 2 and 3 for swatch this pattern calls for half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop see the diagram below for where to find that loop in your stitch thanks to www creativejewishmom com for the awesome diagram crossing paths cowl - tara briggs 2 abbreviations chain - chain slip_stitch - slip_stitch half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet skip - skip st - stitch double_crochet - double_crochet - repeat this section pattern the pattern is worked in joined rounds without turning chains at the beginning of row do not count as stitches chain 111 251 join with slip_stitch without twisting row 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 1st st and in each chain around slip_stitch into top of 1st half_double_crochet to join 111 251 st row 2 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 3rd loop in first st and in each half_double_crochet around slip_stitch into top of 1st half_double_crochet to join row 3 chain 2 half_double_crochet 1st st and in each half_double_crochet around slip_stitch into top of 1st half_double_crochet to join row 4 repeat row 2 row 5 repeat row 3 row 6 repeat row 2 crossing paths cowl - tara briggs 3 row 7 chain 2 skip 1 st double_crochet 1 in next st double_crochet 1 in skipped st working in front of the st just made around end with 1 double_crochet in last st slip_stitch into top of 1st double_crochet of row 111 251 st row 8 chain 2 double_crochet in each st around slip_stitch into top of 1st double_crochet to join row 9-15 repeat row 7 and 8 ending with a row 7 if you want a shorter cowl work fewer repeats if you want a taller cowl work more repeats in this section row 16 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 1st st and in each st around slip_stitch into top of 1st half_double_crochet to join row 17 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 3rd loop in 1st st and in each st around slip_stitch into top
